comments.commentBody:
Psychopathic greedsters on the take? Who knew?

Deregulatory fervor, lower taxes for the rich, depressed minimum wage, reduced benefits, and people vote for these sleazesters? Hoarding, looting, let's call it what it is.

Time to wake up. (hint: Trump will make it worse)

Because she was Secretary of State, responsible for our nation's foreign policy.

Presidential candidates are not required to release their tax returns and nowhere does it say that the Senate needs to confirm an appointee within a certain period of time.
Allowed to bleed? The bleeding has all been at the behest of Republicans. That said, if Clinton had been more frank earlier, there would have been less of it.

Donald Trump is the person we should be worried about.  He knows nothing about the issues facing the country or the world.  And how about his tax returns?  At least the Clinton foundation helps people in need, what has Donald Trump ever done for anyone except his immediate family.  He is even making money off of this election, by collecting rents, when his campaign is using his properties. Mr. Trump is a complete fraud, hard to believe that people will actually vote for him.

Smarter Living: What to do when you’re not humored by something others find humorous?

Nothing

(Unless you are part of the party pooper clan, then the expectation is for you to rain on their parade in an attempt to lift yourself up from the negative world in which you live)
Yes, it was hilarious (and good advice) even if it took reading the letter to the editor for me to catch on.
Yes.

--Was it even funny?

No.

comments.userDisplayName: Occupy Wall Street Revolutions begin this way
comments.commentBody: Wait a minute. If you take IT seriously, surely you understand that taking the time and bearing the expense of setting up a private e-mail server is not easy or convenient. Unlike Powell who simply used a private e-mail account, not a server, she went to a lot of trouble. That is a stretch of the truth in itself. Yet, she could have eliminated all of her problem is she had turned the server over to an independent entity to sort through the e-mails and yet, she did not. Her own lawyers did the sorting and so called "personal e-mails" were not simply moved to a personal computer - which could have been easily done. They were destroyed with specialized software designed to "shred" them. Maybe you can move past this blatant display of evasion, but I cannot. I cannot vote for someone who is so calavlier in her regard for honesty and truth.
You nailed it.
She signed a document that she had been briefed!  Isn't that enough for a prosecutor to establish guilt?

And this is going to be President of the United States. A person who doesn't remember whether she was briefed on proper handling of classified material. If she can't remember, maybe there is somethng to the questions regarding her health because her excuse is the concussion she suffered.

Of course, to try to conceal her duplicity, this was issued late Friday afternoon on a three day holiday weekend. The airwaves will be really rolling come Tuesday morning. I wonder what morning Joe and his side kick will have to say about this as well as the other apoligists for Clinton as well as the NY Times.
Sorry, but there is no comparison between HRC and Trump. Very simply, Hillary, no matter how you fault her, is rational and Donald is not.

Trump is sued over a casino deal. The Court orders he turn over all the e-mails. Trump sends his lawyer back into Court to say there are no e-mails:

"Judge Jeffrey Streitfeld was stunned. “He has a house up in Palm Beach County listed for $125 million, but he doesn’t keep emails. That’s a tough one,” he said, according to transcripts obtained by USA TODAY. “If somebody starts to put forth as a fact something that doesn’t make any sense to me and causes me to have a concern about their credibility in the discovery process, that's not a good direction to go, and I am really having a hard time with this.”

That's a judicial view/comment on Trump and how he conducts himself.

@Al.  And let's not forget about the headline today that informs us of emails that "raise questions" about Clinton Foundation "ties" to the State Dept.  Buried in paragraph four of the article is the revelation that the email referenced in the headline demonstrates that the a donor to the CF asked for a diplomatic passport and the Clinton State Dept. DENIED the request. Worthy of Fox News. My head nearly exploded. Honest to God.

Yes. One is legal and increasingly promoted as both socially acceptable and politically preferable.

Shame on us for accepting the currency of selfishness as socially OK.

Every email on the server had at minimum two folks with a copy, most proba
Y had multiple receipants. Most messages were to US Govt entities. To pretend the emails are lost is absolute hogwash. Obama could order every gov employee to provide copies of every message sent to HRC or received from HRC and the it folks at state or defense could search and easily produce every single message from their respective archives. The GOP doesn't want them recovered that woul screw up their fiction. The fact is HRC did nothing she could be prosecuted for including records act as the messages are all archived within other places I the US government.
Hillary Clinton's accusation of dishonesty is benign in comparison to Trump's  customary level of dishonesty from which he enriched himself.

Thank you, Grandpa.
And I hope that the historical context you put it all in is truly appreciated by those who doubt the danger Mr. Trump would pose to this country, were he to become President.
I think that Mr. Trump would have a difficult time removing himself from his Twitter-spere.

She never destroyed anything. You need to understand how email server migrations happen to understand how some data gets archived and other data is consolidated and scrubbed. And, yes, maybe some data got lost by mistake. That happens. And it doesn't mean there was any malicious intent involved.

Do you really think Hillary was technically competent to know how to delete the kind of information you think you're referring to?

There is no THERE there with this. It is totally a partisan witch hunt.
Hillary's emails.......zzzzzzzzzzzzzz....
You're the one not reading. Trump has been (justifiably) savaged in the news pages of the NYT, by the paper's digging and reporting of his actions. Myopic much?

What if Hillary had done what the Trump campaign did with John Kasich? Kasich was offered the vice presidency and "being in charge of foreign and domestic policy" while Trump as president would be national cheerleader "making America great again"!!!

Unlike Trump, Hillary not only wants to be president, she wants to actually do the job and has the experience to prove it. Trump wants to 'be president' the same way a pretty girl wants to win a beauty pageant - to be wearing the sash "Miss -----" Trump wants to be able to parade around wearing a sash that says "President" but he obviously doesn't want to do the work. Trump's never done an honest day's work in his life when he could con someone out of their money. Work is for suckers.

As Trump is a man who reportedly won't learn anything, has zero attention span, never reads anything and does as little work as possible, I honestly can't figure out how Trump graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. Maybe the NYT wants to look into that?

Enough with the NYT's false equivalency of pounding Hillary while not even scratching the surface of Trump's frauds, cons, lies, bankruptcies, civil rights crimes, use of slave labor in Dubai.

Cover it and report it, NYT.

Thank you, Paul. You said, "There is no way Hillary or any elected official should be given the opportunity to use a private email server." I agree.

During the famous 11-hour interview of Hillary by the Benghazi Committee last spring, Rep. Ted Lieu of California's 33rd Cong. district pointed out that EVERY member of Congress is AUTOMATICALLY granted a security clearance without vetting and many of them, if not all, use their own private email servers.

So, I suggest that the Trump campaign and the Republicans and the media now ask the FBI for ALL the emails of all our elected Congress members to see what dire secrets they've given away and what crimes they've committed.

Thirty years is way past time for all these Republican-and-media-created "ClintonGate" witch-hunts to end. (But they sell papers and air-time.)

On this matter, I'm with him:

"The American people are sick and tired of hearing about [her] damn emails."
And why did Donald Trump bribe the the Florida AG? If you can answer that query, then you know why Trump is unfit for office.
She is a better choice than trump which testifies to how truly god-awful he is.

Stick to the alt right websites- you'll get no support for your conjecture here. After a woman has been investigated 10 times by congressional task forces on Benghazi (all of which proved nothing) I can't imagine why she would bring five lawyers.

Why HilLiary had 5 lawyers present at this interview. Here are the highlights:

1. She stated that she did not recall or remember 38 times;
2. Huma Abedin had a Clinton.com email account;
3. She admitted sending emails containing State Department business to staff on their personal email accounts, claiming to have only done so when their .gov accounts were down;
4. She denied any knowledge of how her lawyers decided which emails were personal and which related to State Department work;
5. She did not review any emails her lawyers deleted to determine for herself if they were personal or related to State Department & did not provide input for process to decide what was work related;
6. She did not recall receiving training on document classification (allows her to avoid a finding of intentionally violating such training);
7. She claimed to have relied on others professionalism in handling sensitive material 17 times in the interview, again an excuse to avoid intent.

And she is a better choice than Trump???

Clinton's problems are due to her own carelessness, and desire to avoid transparency. If she were at a summit meeting, she would forget her confidential brief book on the conference table.

When you leave things vulnerable to discovery, they get discovered.

The emails are a tempest in a teapot. Compare with Iran-Contra--that was real treachery and they all skated. Benghazi? Compare with 269 Marines killed in Lebanon.

This is all about complicity between a Republican Congress and a Republican FBI. That I get. What I don't get is this: Doesn't even a Republican FBI care if Putin is putting his thumb on our Presidential election. It is the USA's FBI.

How could it be that the FBI and Mr. Comey are vying with Mr. Putin, acting through Wikileaks, to see who can help Trump the most. I actually think the FBI/Comey are winning the contest, with their exquisitely timed releases, exactly when Trump needs the help the most.

The NYTimes for its part, finds it an easy sell to feature the ready-made 'news' trickling out. It's right there! You don't have to do anything but print it! EMAILS!! MORE EMAILS!! OMG!! ELECTRONIC DEVICES SHE'S GOT NOW!!

Gentlemen and gentlewomen of the NYTimes, have you forgotten Putin's hack not only of the DNC and the NSA hacking team, but also state electoral databases? Putin, acting on his own and through Wikileaks, has penetrated well into the US Presidential election for 2016. These hacks are affirmed by US high intelligence and other professionals. Comey's response was a pro-forma letter to the states--be on guard. Now back to the important stuff--the emails. Have you forgotten Trump's many ties, and his advisors' ties to Putin and RT news? Can you not connect the dots? Trump is Putin's guy.

Is there not a story here? Would Trump as President sell out NATO as he has promised he would, in exchange for a favorable siting decision (and financing) from Putin. NY Times and others are highly obsessed about the Clinton foundation if Hillary is President: Has you ever wondered about what Trump would do to help Trump INC?

comments.userLocation: up in the woods down by the river
comments.commentBody: Destruction of evidence.

That's your right. But anyone considering Jill Stein should take a good hard honest look at her. She's an opportunist with some ideas that are peculiar for a medical doctor. I would prefer a coalition form of government that included greens, but would never vote for her. She couldn't stand the kind of scrutiny Hillary is subjected to for five minutes.
